Literature Review: The recent resurgence of initial public offerings (IPOs) and special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs) in the United States has sparked renewed interest in alternative mechanisms for going public. This literature review examines the recent developments in IPOs and SPACs, with a focus on the differences between traditional IPOs, mergers with SPACs, and direct listings. We also discuss the implications of dual-class share structures on the going-public process and the role of venture capital in facilitating IPOs.
